issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

components.name: Studio
components.description: Please enter tickets related to Titanium Studio here.

fields.description:
I just wanted to report this because it has happened a few times lately (3 times in the past month).

Problem: For whatever reason OSX will fatally crash, restarting the machine, this has happened recently while using Titanium Studio. Looking at the error report below it looks like it might have something to do with Studio, but im not sure so here is the apple crash report for your records:

fields.summary: Studio: Occasional Mac OSX FATAL crash
fields.environment:
iMac
27-inch, Late 2009
Processor  2.8 GHz Intel Core i7
Memory  12 GB 1067 MHz DDR3
Graphics  ATI Radeon HD 4850 512 MB
Software  OS X 10.8.2 (12C60)

comments.body: Thanks for the report. Please can you state your Studio version? Also, I'm not sure it would be possible for our platform team to know what the problem is without some further info and logs -- what are you usually doing in Studio at the time of the crash? Is there anything in the Studio logs when this happens? (Help -> Titanium Studio -> View Log File)

Studio version @ latest BETA 3.02+, it has been happening across multiple versions. I havent noticed anything specific in Studio that im doing but usually saving a document, Ive watched the Heap also which doesn't seem to get overly high. Also it has been happening a bit more frequently, once a week or so. Ill attach the studio log next time it happens.

** Also this has ONLY been happening when Studio is open and Im working with it **
